title: "Nasus is late game"
body:
Yeah, that's a nice thought, until you get to late game, and find out that freezing lane to no tactical effect while your enemy roams all over the map, forcing 4v5s while you calmly afk farm for 30 minutes straight, doesn't really leave you in a place to "carry" lategame. It's a decent thought, until you realize nobody gives a crap about the extra 100 or so dps you've added through a few hundred stacks from that stellar "late-game" tactic, when the other team has - uh, what's it called? Oh right! - LATEGAME CHAMPIONS (you know, the actual ones) that dish out 9 times that amount on every autoattack every half a second.

I'm almost tempted to start dodging every time I see a Nasus player. About 95% of them can't figure out that the outcome of a game doesn't revolve around a purple number on an ability tooltip. I can pretty much start placing bets on guaranteed loss the moment one of them brings up something about "lategame". You mean that stage where your puppy face gets melted before you can get off 2 Q's? Sure, good luck with that. I'm sure that warrants last-hitting minions 20 feet away from an enemy tower for 3-4 minutes straight through two teamfights mid long past the laning phase, and never ever even touching that objective right in your face (yes, that happened. That almost always happens. Just another day in a game with the doggy.)

Veigar's a mega-burster. Plus if either of them is better at shredding with q, it's Veigar by midgame with his q hitting up to 2 minions.

But since they removed zephyr, one of the best backdooring items in the game, its  not fun at all to backdoor as anyone who cant delete waves.

I also fucking hate nasus with a passion, but for different reasons. For one, his laning is stupidly boring to play against. It's just him having defensive runes and items, me unable to kill him or stop him from farming. If I hard engage on him he'll wither and ignore me, or just straight up kill me if he's got ult, if I push him to tower, he'll wither and I'll get my ass ganked. 

Out of sheer boredom I'll TP bot for the easy double kill down there, what does Nasus do? Stays in lane and by the time I'm back there he's in my base. Boring as shit.
What's sad is that Nasus wins most lanes still...he's fucking overpowered, too many dueling tools. He honestly doesn't even teamfight well, but he can still 1v2 most jungler/tops by level 11.
Never had that issue. Then again, I play a lot of Nasus counters.

There's no real Nasus counter. He builds nearly full defense and does stacking flat damage w/ armor shred as well as % damage. The only champion that I believe truly beats Nasus is Lulu.

>the outcome of a game doesn't revolve around a purple number on an ability tooltip

It does when that little purple number allows you to oneshot the adc with just a flash.

Was that adc at 5 bars of health, or did you have an infinity edge? How much of the enemy front line was NOT there when said adc got stupidly close to you? Do you spam flash in every fight, or are you actually restricted by these things called cooldowns? How cool is it to get melted in 4 seconds after you burn your one escape placing yourself as deep into the enemy team as possible?

Its called farming your Q, you farm your Q and shove your cane into theirs adcs/mid ass regardless of frontline since you can just flash and go in, the whole gamestyle of nasus is if he can land that 700 stacked Q into a squishy, building tank is just something you do to not get melted so fast.
{{item:3024}} against AD or {{item:3211}} against AP is basically "late game" for Nasus. If you didnt hard counter and kill him 3 times already by that time, you probably wont win top anymore lol.

I've laned against several Nasus players that spam dances in between q-stacking with that thought in mind... and then proceed to die 15 minutes later because, duh, I know how to counterbuild against tank items.

Late-game, Nasus is susceptible to being bursted and/or kited during teamfights when the enemy team plays properly.  At this point, people are grouping and the damage-dealers have purchased their percent penetration items.

In my experience, mid-game is really Nasus' strongest point.  If you have around 300-400 stacks, Iceborn Gauntlet and Spirit Visage by 20 minutes into the game, you are a monster during skirmishes and 1v1s.

Honestly, at that point your best bet is often to roam around the map taking towers with your team and fighting for objectives.  If the game extends past the mid-game, you can easily start split-pushing again if necessary.
